name: The "Big Four" Freight House
description: The building here was once used for storing, loading, and unloading freight for the Cleveland, Cincinnati, Chicago & St. Louis Railway (nicknamed the "Big Four Railroad")

name: Gavin Street
description: You can see the wye of the Norfolk Southern yard just to the east.

name: South Walnut Street
description:
All of the major rail lines in Muncie cross Walnut street at this location. From north to south you can see:
  • Norfolk Southern's Frankfort district heading west
  • CSX's double track mainline to Indianapolis
  • Norfolk Southern's New Castle line crossing the CSX main and turning south

name: Wysor Street Depot
description: Built in 1901 by the Cincinnati, Richmond, and Muncie Railroad, this beautifully restored depot now serves as a trailhead for the Cardinal Greenway.
